item.title: Amazon Is Considering a Big Change to Its Distribution Network
item.description: The move could be a major blow to revenue for the United States Postal Service.

item.title: The Reddit CEO Is Making a Big Change Because 1 Part of the Site ‘Sucks’
item.description: Reddit CEO Steve Huffman says the platform is deprioritizing a major subreddit in favor of more personalized feeds. Some users are concerned.

item.title: Google Just Shared How the Next Generation of Leaders Are Really Using AI
item.description: Young professionals say that AI makes them confident, but there’s still a disconnect when it comes to one key issue.

item.title: Piling on Trump DOJ’s legitimacy issues, Letitia James challenges appointment of U.S. attorney suing her
item.description: The court hearing focusing on the role of John Sarcone, who is acting as U.S. attorney for northern New York.

item.title: Apple Just Lost a Key Designer—Many Are Happy to See Him Go
item.description: The longtime Apple designer, responsible for the Apple Watch and Liquid Glass, is heading to Meta. Industry voices are pleased.

item.title: Congress flatlines in attempt to regulate college sports with bill ‘not ready for prime time’
item.description: It’s only the latest delay for a bill that had appeared headed for passage over the summer before repeatedly hitting roadblocks.

item.title: Detroit’s bizarre romance with its very own RoboCop statue reaches happy ending, 15 years after love/hate crowdfunding campaign kicked it off
item.description: The statue campaign appears to have started around 2010 when Detroit Mayor Dave Bing was tagged in a tweet about Philadelphia's "Rocky" statue.

item.title: 6 Places to Find Your Next Freelance Hire
item.description: Freelance platform Fiverr published a list of the fastest growing cities for solopreneurs—the results may surprise you.

item.title: Spotify users lamented Wrapped in 2024. This year, the company brought back an old favorite and made it less about AI
item.description: Spotify received blowback in 2024 for going all-in on AI at the last minute.
